answers.answer: You need to get those checked by a dr! My friend just had to be induced early because she had very high blood pressure. Her only symptom was giant ankles
I would call my ob asap and let them know what's going on. I had swollen ankles when I was pregnant with my 2nd child and founded out I had preeclampsia too.
I know someone in just about every state with big hearts if you need a place to stay. What state areyou in?

Have you tried going to a shelter? Sleeping in a car has got to be very uncomfortable and I'm sure unhealthy for you since you're probably not able to stretch out and rest. Also have you tried the local family and children services?

Sorry for not writing back I haven't had any wifi...I have been asking for help from family services its just hard hearing from them bc I move around a lot..I am out of the car now so everything is slowly but surely going down..I just found out my medicaid has become inactive which I can't figure out why and if it doesn't come back on I won't be able to go to the doctors bc I'll have to pay 354 dollars which I def don't have..I'm trying to stay positive but I know I'm not gonna be able to keep my baby it wouldnt be fair to her..I know I would be a great mom but if I can't even take care of myself how in the world am I gonna be able to take care of my baby

Try talking to different obs some are willing to take ppl for very cheap or free.  I had a dr that did all the time in WA state, she said she rather them be seen and have a safe pregnancy then get paid.  Also look for a YMCA they may be able to help with shelter and medical assistance.
And even finding a job and daycare if you want an option to keep baby.

question: Will having swollen feet and not being able to put my feet up for days  affect my baby in any way? I'm currently living in my car so I can't put my feet up and my ankles and feet have literally tripled in size.
title: swollen feet
